results.title: Two hands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Gregor Jordan, Marian MacGowan, Meridian Films and CML
results.brief_description: Set in Sydney’s King’s Cross, 19 year old Jimmy (Heath Ledger) finds himself in debt to a local gangster, Pando, played by perennial Australian actor Bryan Brown, when a simple job goes wrong. Jimmy’s life depends on his locating the $10,000 he has lost. As his scheme to replace the cash is played out, two street kids are enjoying a shopping spree with the original loot. The black humour of the film progressively darkens as the story unfolds. Rose Byrne co-stars as country girl, Alex, who becomes involved with Jimmy and his increasingly dire situation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gregor Jordan, Marian MacGowan, Meridian Films and CML

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Ninolakis the Poet]
results.brief_description:
This silent film shows an intimate lounge room party and poetry reading by a poet known as Ninolakis.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Miss Greek Charity Quest]
results.brief_description:
This silent film shows people at the Athenaeum Club in Melbourne celebrating the New Year and finalists of the Miss Greek Charity Quest.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: Turner girl
results.creator_credit: Leeanne Hill, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Leeanne Hill goes through the journey to finding out she has Turner’s Syndrome to the daily challenges and long term effects.

results.title: Turning perceptions
results.creator_credit: Karlene Lynch, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Karlene Lynch found out when she was 21 that she had Turner’s Syndrome. Despite the agony of being infertile and the health difficulties, Lynch has led a happy and inspiring life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karlene Lynch, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Greek Boy Scouts and Girl Guides supporting Bishop at Festival Hall]
results.brief_description:
This silent film shows the Greek Boy Scouts and other children assembling to celebrate National Day of the Greek Community, 25th March 1966 at Festival Hall, Melbourne.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: What a whirlwind relationship!
results.creator_credit: Lucy Pucci, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Two months into their relationship, Lucy Pucci told her partner that she has Turner’s Syndrome and won’t be able to have children. He stuck by her then, just as he has stuck by her through their various agonising attempts to have children of their own.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lucy Pucci, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: First Greek Community Dance at Exhibition Centre 1961]
results.brief_description:
This film shows the first Greek Community Dance held at the Royal Exhibition Buildings, Melbourne in 1961.

The film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Easter celebrations at Green Hill]
results.brief_description:
This film shows Greek Easter celebrations, including a community BBQ, cooking lamb on a spit, music and dancing.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.
